intro: Aulacospermum stylosum, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a low, spreading shrub with small, green leaves and inconspicuous yellow flowers. Its structure is characterized by a fibrous root system and a branching stem that supports its compact form. Aulacospermum stylosum is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid environments.
